title: 108_hr4931
content: The Act titled "Intelligent Vehicle Highway Safety Act of 2004" introduces a deduction for intelligent vehicle technology systems under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Act "Intelligent Vehicle Highway Safety Act of 2004" allows a deduction for qualified intelligent vehicle systems property under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The deduction is limited to $1,000 per motor vehicle and is phased out for property placed in service after December 31, 2007. The Act allows a deduction for qualified intelligent vehicle systems property under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The deduction is limited to $1,000 per motor vehicle and is phased out for property placed in service after December 31, 2007. Qualified intelligent vehicle systems property includes devices that enhance safety or security in motor vehicles. The Act allows a deduction for qualified intelligent vehicle systems property under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, limited to $1,000 per motor vehicle. This property includes devices that enhance safety or security, such as warning systems, communications devices, driver verification tools, electronic seals, roll stability control systems, and driver workload monitors. The term 'motor vehicle' is defined as a vehicle primarily for public road use with at least 4 wheels. Special rules state that no deduction is allowed for property used outside the US or for the portion of property cost taken into account under another section. The basis of property is reduced by the cost taken into account for deduction purposes. The deduction allowable under subsection (a) for property subject to depreciation is treated as a depreciation deduction under section 167. Supporting documentation is required for the deduction, detailing the type and cost of intelligent vehicle systems installed on the motor vehicle. The deduction for intelligent vehicle systems property is allowed under section 199, with supporting documentation required for the type and cost of systems installed. This deduction does not apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2010. Conforming amendments are made to section 1016 of the Code. The deduction for intelligent vehicle systems property under section 199 is amended to include section 1245(a)(2) and the table of sections for part VI of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Code. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2004. The tax on heavy trucks and trailers sold at retail is amended to exclude qualified intelligent vehicle systems property up to $5,000. This amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2004. The amendments made by this section, effective after December 31, 2004, apply to articles sold.
